data.title: For the Next-Gen of Telugu Cinema
data.meta_description: 6 posts published by maverix6, aluysoj, and Haarika Kanuparthy during May 2013
data.meta_site_name: For the Next-Gen of Telugu Cinema
data.text:
I thought Puri lost it completely when he made “nenu naa raakshasi” but now he is beyond our grasp, all he needs is either a musical therapy or the electric shock( like Ali in this movie) to alleviate his madness. … Continue reading →

The 18th European Film Festival has finally announced the schedule of films lined up for Hyderabad. The festival is from 25th May to 8th June. The Schedule can be seen here http://eeas.europa.eu/delegations/india/documents/hyderabad_screening_schedule.pdf The Venues are Prasadz Imax, Alliance Francaise(AF), Goethe-Zentrum(GZ) … Continue reading →

A movie trying to emphasize the importance and value of relationships in a world riddled with materialistic and selfish concerns. The protagonist is the one who believes that anything is possible without love right from his childhood (because of being … Continue reading →

Aithe, Anukokunda oka roju, Okkadunnadu, Prayanam – each movie had a fresh story, marvelous screenplay and non conformity to regular masala entertainment. Chandra Sekhar Yeleti has always been one of the most promising directors of our times. Last time when someone … Continue reading →

Renowned director B Narsing Rao’s films are being screened in Hyderabad from May 4th to May 10th, Unfortunately his most critically acclaimed film Daasi was screened today. Daasi had won 5 National awards in 1988. Maa Ooru which also won … Continue reading →

Once again, our sincere thanks to Mr. Anish Kuruvilla for providing us with the screenplay of Ko Antey Koti. The response to Avakai Biryani has been overwhelming which has encouraged us to obtain more screenplays for Telugu movie fans to … Continue reading →
